content: Just an observation here... If you also use the Allmail folder, remember that it is a duplicate. If you do not need it, I suggest you unsubscribe from it and delete from profile. That will reduce your disk usage and improve overall performance.
creator: davidsk

content: Hi David, The Allmail folder is just a listing of all items, regardless of tags. Deleting from Allmail deletes the item-- it is not really a duplicate. But thanks for the suggestion. Ben
creator: bgrinstein

content: I suggest you review the size of allmail on your harddrive. In gmail, there is only one copy of all messages, but to imitate gmail, thunderbird creates a second copy of all messages. This doubles downloads, sends, and deletes.
creator: davidsk

content:
Since this is for a business, rather than offer a 'fix', I offer a strategy. - I would revert to a version that is stable for your environment - set all copies to NOT update automatically. - if thunderbird is meeting business needs, do NOT update for six months - at six month intervals (or whatever works for you) review release notes of latest update and update one PC. use the update for a minimum of a week on the PC, doing all normal workload tasks. Then, once you're comfortable, update the other PCs.

In essence, treat Thunderbird as any other business tool: don't change just to change. update when the update keeps you eligible for support and when the update adds useful features. For example, 128 is the current release and 115 was the prior release. Requesting help for any version prior to 115 may go unheeded or you will be asked to upgrade immediately. There, just my suggestion, based on my own experience with business software.  :)
creator: davidsk

content: Firefox is just a Browser. If your having issues with your email provider then you need to contact their email support. Also this is the Browser help section there is a TB section. TB doesn't have email server that comes from your POP3/IMAP setting connect to the actual email server. TB only retrieves and reads and send from the email provider when you use TB.

content:
Hello there

Verify that the SMTP setting for the outgoing mail is correct, that the SMTP server is oke. Other things could block this sending service. Had you have a update lately on the pc? Could be that Thunderbird is not trusted after these updates ,now but the previous version still is or does.you can delete Thunderbird from the list of trusted software and place it back. Ports can being blocked by using old numbers for them in or for the SMTP setting area of the outgoing service for it. Try to use a different portnumber ,the other port number should be 587 instead of the 25 number for the outgoing port service .

Greetings Firefox volunteer
creator: Googlethunderbird

content:
Try toggling mail.strict_threading to false in Settings/General, Config. editor. See if that works after Subjects are modified.

Otherwise, you might try modifying the References header with the second add-on above.

http://kb.mozillazine.org/Stop_threading_by_subject
creator: sfhowes

content: Hi again. When I got to mail.strict_threading it was already set to FALSE. So I toggled it to TRUE and tried the name change and it worked!!! So thank you!!

content:
Informazioni utili da fornire nelle richieste al forum:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)

content: As I understand it, you created a new profile and it worked ok, but then copied in the old profile, and problems returned. That indicates the old profile is corrupted in some way. Instead, I would have copied just the local mail into the new profile: copy the mbox files in the old Mail/Local Folders and Mail/<popservername> locations to Mail/Local Folders in the new profile. Add the accounts to the new profile, and copy the abook.sqlite and history.sqlite address book files from the old profile.
creator: sfhowes

content:
In the new profile, you have to add all accounts, POP or IMAP, but the method I suggested allows the old POP mail or Local Folders to be copied into the new profile. It looks like you tried to copy folders instead of just the mbox files, which is much more reliable.

Create a new, empty profile, add the accounts, and copy the mbox files and address books as described.

content:
Your Gmail IMAP folders mirror the server, so mail you delete should be deleted in both places. Therefore, if you want to back up some amount of your Gmail messages before deleting, you can copy them to a Local folder (a completely offline, non-synchronized folder).

I'm not sure how best to do this in a way that matches what you plan to do in your Gmail mailbox. Hopefully another support volunteer has a suggestion.

This will help you permanently resolve the false positive content filter block"

So I'm wondering if they are being confused between the PC and Android version

content: Select a set of messages then Ctrl+S to save them as eml files. Eml files can be opened in any mail app, or imported to a subfolder of Local Folders in TB by drag and drop from File Explorer.
